analytic.title: Christians Becoming Christians: Conversions, Conversion-Motifs and Doctrinal Boundaries in the Sixth Century

monogr.title: Across the Mediterranean – Along the Nile: Studies in Egyptology, Nubiology and Late Antiquity Dedicated to László Török on the Occasion of His 75th Birthday

body.bibl: Menze, Volker-Lorenz. “Christians Becoming Christians: Conversions, Conversion-Motifs and Doctrinal Boundaries in the Sixth Century.” In Across the Mediterranean – Along the Nile: Studies in Egyptology, Nubiology and Late Antiquity Dedicated to László Török on the Occasion of His 75th Birthday, edited by Tamás A. Bács, Ádám Bollók, and Tivadar Vida, 2:849–61. Budapest: Institute of Archaeology, Research Centre for the Humanities, Hungarian Academy of Sciences, 2018.

Volker-Lorenz Menze, Christians Becoming Christians: Conversions, Conversion-Motifs and Doctrinal Boundaries in the Sixth Century, in Across the Mediterranean – Along the Nile: Studies in Egyptology, Nubiology and Late Antiquity Dedicated to László Török on the Occasion of His 75th Birthday, ed. Tamás A. Bács, Ádám Bollók, and Tivadar Vida, vol. 2 (Budapest: Institute of Archaeology, Research Centre for the Humanities, Hungarian Academy of Sciences, 2018), 849–61.
